Key Match Events: Jaren Jackson Jr. scored 38 points to lead the Memphis Grizzlies to a 117-112 victory over the Phoenix Suns
Konchar's three-point play with 1:05 left gave Memphis a 113-106 lead after the Suns had come within one point earlier
Pre-Game Insights: The Grizzlies, playing without injured Ja Morant (right shoulder strain) and Zach Edey (concussion protocol), never trailed.
Booker started slow but got back in the rhythm by scoring the Suns' first five points of the second quarter.
Post-Match Reflections: The Suns lost for the sixth time in seven games.
Jackson Jr. was 10 of 17 from the line and also finished with 10 rebounds.
Miscellaneous Highlights: There were 54 fouls called in the game and 58 free throws attempted.
Booker last played Dec. 19 in a loss to Indiana.
Others: The Grizzlies are at Sacramento on Friday.
The Suns play Saturday at Indiana.
